intro: Arthrophytum pallidiflorum, commonly known as the pale-flowered stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in dry environments. The plant produces small, pale yellow or greenish flowers during the growing season, typically in summer. It grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its slow growth and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
